benchmark_details.name: Dolma (Data for Open Language Models' Appetite)
benchmark_details.overview: Dolma is a three-trillion-token English corpus built from a diverse mixture of web content, scientific papers, code, public-domain books, social media, and encyclopedic materials, aimed at facilitating scientific research on language model pretraining through improved data transparency and reproducibility.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To promote transparency, reproducibility, and further research in language modeling by providing a comprehensive and well-documented dataset.

data.source: Dolma corpus collected from a diverse set of sources including web pages, scientific papers, code from GitHub, public domain books, social media content, and encyclopedic materials.
data.annotation: Automated filtering, language identification, quality filtering, and deduplication.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using perplexity evaluations on various downstream tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower perplexity indicates better model performance on language tasks; higher accuracy indicates better performance on specific benchmarks used for evaluation.
methodology.validation: The Dolma corpus was validated against known benchmarks in language modeling tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of the demographic factors is recommended for assessing the diversity of the provided content.
harm: Potential for perpetuating bias in language models due to the sourcing of data from the web and other repositories.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Efforts were made to remove personally identifiable information (PII) through filtering and regex identification.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under ODC-By license, with terms for usage outlined on the Hugging Face page.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: No direct informed consent was collected from data contributors; however, a mechanism for data removal is available.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The dataset aims for compliance with GDPR principles and provides avenues for individuals to request data removal.
